item.title: joncgoodwin@gmail.com on "MALLET - adding to the stopword list"
item.dc:creator: joncgoodwin@gmail.com
item.description:
I'd recommend using the word frequency lists, though you have to convert them using the method I described in the post you linked to in your original question. These lists are more reliable, I believe, than text extracted from PDFs would be, and smaller and easier to manage.

I also believe that the word frequency lists do a better job of removing roman numerals and publishing abbreviations, though many of those do remain. In the models I've run, OCR artifacts have tended to cluster into their own topic, which make them easy to ignore. Is that happening with yours?

item.title: EmmaClarke on "MALLET - adding to the stopword list"

item.title: joncgoodwin@gmail.com on "MALLET - adding to the stopword list"
item.dc:creator: joncgoodwin@gmail.com
item.description: Did you use the Data for Research interface to download word frequency lists, or did you extract text from PDFs? It's hard to diagnose what's going on without having your data. If it's from DfR, I can download a sample and see if I have a problem as well.

item.title: EmmaClarke on "MALLET - adding to the stopword list"
item.dc:creator: EmmaClarke
item.description:
My data is text extracted from JSTOR PDFs.

Yes, for the most part the topics are as I would expect.

In terms of the extra stopwords file, I created it with one word per line also / all lowercase.

I have tried placing the stop.txt file in both the C:\mallet directory and also the C:\mallet\stoplists directory.

item.title: joncgoodwin@gmail.com on "MALLET - adding to the stopword list"
item.dc:creator: joncgoodwin@gmail.com
item.description:
MALLET will stop running if it can't find the extra-stopwords file, so I guess that didn't happen. I'm not 100% sure about how it parses the file, but I created mine with one word per line.

Is your data from JSTOR? There may be a problem at that stage. Are the topics themselves what you'd expect other than the stopwords?

item.title: EmmaClarke on "MALLET - adding to the stopword list"
item.dc:creator: EmmaClarke
item.description:
Hi,

I'm currently using MALLET to topic model 19th century journal articles.

I am running into trouble adding to the stopword list. I have tried adding my additional terms to the standard 'en' list that comes with MALLET (using Notepad++) but MALLET is not recognising these.

I also tried the method at the end of this post: http://www.jgoodwin.net/?p=1036

Neither of these have worked as I am still seeing words from the stopword list in my output.

Any ideas welcome.
